description: Peak Rewards is TVA's demand response program operated in partnership with Enel North America. The program provides seasonal payments to commercial, industrial, institutional, and organizational customers who agree to reduce electricity consumption during periods of peak demand. The program operates year-round with events called during grid stress periods, primarily during extreme weather conditions.

geography.notes: TVA serves portions of seven southeastern states through 153 local power companies

customer_classes.size_threshold_notes: Program is available to businesses, schools, nonprofits, churches, and other commercial/industrial organizations

eligibility.notes: Enel manages enrollment, measurement, verification, and payments on behalf of TVA. For larger facilities (>1 MW), PowerFlex program may be more appropriate.

notification.notification_notes: 30-minute advance notice provided before events. Participants select their preferred notification method(s). Cloud-based energy intelligence software provides 24/7/365 real-time monitoring.

capacity_rate.notes: Program provides 'seasonal payment' but specific $/kW rates are not publicly disclosed. Payment rates appear to be customized per participant based on enrolled capacity and performance capabilities.

performance_rate.notes: Program primarily offers capacity-based seasonal payments rather than per-event performance payments

payment_structure.payment_notes: Metro Nashville Public Schools case study: earned $400,000 over 10 years of participation covering 60 locations. Since 2015, all TVA demand response customers (through Enel) have earned more than $1.325 billion in total payments. No upfront or out-of-pocket costs to participate.

seasons.notes: Program operates year-round with up to 32 event hours per fiscal year (October 1 - September 30)

call_windows.notes: Events are called between 5 AM and 8 PM Central Time

event_parameters.notes: Events typically last 4 hours. Metro Nashville Public Schools case study mentions events lasting 'about 4 hours'. Maximum 32 event hours per TVA fiscal year (October - September).

event_triggers.trigger_description: Events are called during periods of exceptionally high electricity demand, typically during extreme weather conditions (summer heat waves, winter storms). TVA calls events to maintain grid reliability and prevent blackouts during peak demand periods.
event_triggers.examples: December 2022 Winter Storm Elliott required emergency load reductions (highest winter peak in TVA history at 33,425 MW). Summer 2024 saw 13 days with peaks over 28,000 MW, with August 29 reaching 31,096 MW.

nomination_bidding.notes: Participants must enroll through Enel North America. Enrollment appears to be ongoing rather than limited to specific periods. Contact required for enrollment details.

special_attributes: Cloud-based energy intelligence software access provided
Advanced notification of grid stability issues
Full management by Enel (enrollment, measurement, verification, payments)
Contributes to grid reliability and regional electricity affordability

program_evolution.change_description: Partnership with Enel established (or formalized tracking began). Since 2015, customers have earned $1.325+ billion.
Program continues as 'Peak Rewards' (formerly known as 'Peak Power Partners'). PowerFlex program introduced for larger facilities (>1 MW).

program_history.notes: TVA announced in October 2024 that it is investing $1.5 billion through 2027 on energy efficiency incentives and demand response programs. Nearly 600 demand response participants contribute over 1,100 MW during peak events.

historical_events.notes: Winter Storm Elliott - TVA experienced highest winter peak in history at 33,425 MW on December 23 at 7 PM CDT. TVA required all 153 local power companies to reduce load - first time in TVA's 90-year history implementing emergency procedures.
Power demand reached 31,096 MW at 3 PM CT on August 29, 2024 - highest levels of summer 2024. TVA experienced 13 days with peaks over 28,000 MW in summer 2024.

case_studies.energy_reduction_achieved: 8% reduction in first year, targeting 16% total over 5 years
case_studies.additional_savings: Annual budget reduced from $21M to $18M, saving $3M
case_studies.quote: The great incentive with this program is that not only are we reducing our energy consumption and saving money during a Demand Response event, but we are also getting paid to participate.

powerflex_program.description: Emergency and capacity program for larger facilities
powerflex_program.notes: PowerFlex offers higher demand and energy credits compared to Peak Rewards. IP5 and IP30 participants encouraged to transition to PowerFlex. Flexible notification times and more capacity hour options.

ip5_program.description: 5-minute notice reliability-only product with monthly demand credits

ip30_program.description: 30-minute notice reliability and economics product with monthly demand credits and event-based energy credits

research_notes: Conducted comprehensive web research on TVA Peak Rewards program on 2025-10-11. Program is well-documented for general parameters (eligibility, event windows, notification) but specific financial details (payment rates, penalties) are not publicly disclosed. TVA operates through partnership with Enel North America who manages all program operations. Program appears to use customized payment structures based on individual participant capacity and performance capabilities rather than published fixed rates. Found excellent case study (Metro Nashville Public Schools) providing real earnings data over 10-year period. Winter Storm Elliott (Dec 2022) and Summer 2024 heat waves provide context for actual event calls. TVA is investing $1.5B through 2027 in DR programs, indicating strong commitment. For complete financial details, direct contact with Enel or TVA would be required. The 32-hour annual limit was verified from multiple sources. PowerFlex program exists as separate offering for larger customers (>1MW) with different structure. Overall data quality is good for operational parameters but limited for financial specifics.

integration_metadata.api_notes: Enel provides cloud-based energy intelligence software with 24/7 real-time monitoring. API access likely available to participants but documentation not publicly available.
integration_metadata.verification_thoroughness: Comprehensive web research conducted including program pages, case studies, press releases, and local utility information. Primary limitation is lack of published payment rate schedules.

integration_metadata.notes: Program is mature, well-established, and actively operating with substantial participant base (600 participants, 1,100+ MW). Payment structures appear customized rather than published fixed rates. Good candidate for battery optimization given 30-minute notification, year-round availability, and predictable call windows (5 AM - 8 PM). The 32-hour annual limit is relatively modest, allowing for other revenue stacking opportunities.
